Instructions: Look straight at the camera, with your face in a neutral position for 10 seconds. Please have your teeth together in the normal bite but without clenching.
Smile big. Repeat 3 times.
Pucker your lips and then return to neutral. Repeat 3 times
Alternate between a big smile and puckering your lips as fast as possible for 5-6 seconds.

We provided you with a nose clip. Please attach  it on your nose when ready to perform the task. With the nose clip on your nose, puff out your cheeks with your mouth firmly closed and hold it for 5 seconds if possible. If not possible, please skip this task.
Press your tongue against the inside your left cheek for 3-5 seconds, then go back to normal. Press your tongue against the inside your right cheek for 3-5 seconds, then go back to normal.
Move your face close to the camera. Open your mouth and relax your tongue for about 10 seconds.
Please position yourself back at the correct distance from the camera and sit straight. Turn your head towards your right shoulder. Stick your tongue straight out, as far as possible. Repeat 3 times.
Look straight. Stick our your tongue and move it far as your can to the right. (pause) Move it as far as you can to the left. Repeat 3 times.
Point the tip of your tongue up towards your nose and down towards your chin. Repeat 3 times.
Stick out your tongue and move it from side-to-side, touching the corners of your mouth, as fast as you can for 5-6 seconds.
Stick your tongue out with your lips firmly closed around it. Puff out your cheeks and hold it for 5-6 seconds.
Say "a" for about 5-6 seconds, while alternating between pinching and un-pinching your nose.
Say "We see three geese" at your comfortable speaking rate and loudness, pausing briefly between each repetition. Repeat 3 times.
Open your mouth as wide as is comfortable, without hurting yourself, then go back to normal. Repeat 3 times.
Open and close your mouth as wide and as fast as you can, without hurting yourself. Keep on moving for 5-6 seconds."
Please say "aaa" at your normal pitch and loudness for 10-12 seconds.
Read the sentences below at your normal speaking rate and loudness.
Say /a/ starting at your normal pitch, then glide your pitch up high and hold it as high as you can for a few seconds. Repeat 2 times.
Please read out loud at normal comfortable speaking rate and loudness.
Take a deep breath and repeat "pa" as fast and as clearly as you can, until you run out of one breath.
Take a deep breath and repeat "ta" as fast and as clearly as you can, until you run out of one breath.
Take a deep breath and repeat ka" as fast and as clearly as you can, until you run out of one breath.
Take a deep breath and repeat "pataka" as fast and as clearly as you can, until you run out of one breath.
Cough hard as if you have something stuck in your throat. Repeat 2 times. Do not cover your mouth.

Please fill the cup you were provided with water. It must be full. Drink the cup of water completely and without stopping. After you're done swallowing, say "aaa" for 2-3 seconds. Ensure to tilt the cup, not your head.
Eat the cracker, as quickly as is comfortably and safely as possible. When you are finished chewing and swallowing the cracker in its entirety, say "I'm done".
Say "Buy Bobby a Puppy" 10 times at your comfortable speaking rate and loudness. Pause briefly between each repetition.

Please carefully look at the picture below. Describe the picture in as much detail as possible. Please try to speak for at least 1 to 2 minutes.  Start recording when ready and then stop recording when finished.

Say as many words as you can that start with the letter "F" in 1 minute. You cannot say the names of people, places or numbers. Please do not say the same word with just a different ending, like "truck" and "trucks". Start recording when ready and then stop recording when finished.
Please tell me about a memorable vacation or trip you have taken. Please try to speak for at least 1 to 2 minutes. Start recording when ready and then stop recording when finished.
Please name as many animals as you can in 1 minute.  Start recording when ready and then stop recording when finished.
